Package nz.ac.vuw.ecs.swen225.gp20.maze

  • Class Summary 
    Class Description
    Actor
    From handout: An Actor is a game character that moves around, like Chap, the hero of the game.
    Chap
    From handout: Chap can be moved by key strokes (up-right-down-left), his movement is restricted by the nature of the tiles (for instance, he cannot move into walls).
    DoorTile
    From handout: Chap can only move onto those tiles if they have the key with the matching colour -- this unlocks the door.
    ExitLockTile
    From handout: Behaves like a wall time for Chap as long as there are still uncollected treasures.
    ExitTile
    From handout: Once Chap reaches this tile, the game level is finished.
    FreeTile
    From handout: Actors can freely move onto those tiles.
    HelpTile
    From handout: Like a free tile, but when Chap steps on this field, a help text will be displayed.
    KeyTile
    From handout: Actors can move onto those tiles.
    Maze
    From handout: This is the domain model that forms the core of the application, it conceptualises the maze, its elements and their interaction.
    MazeTest
    Test suite ensuring game logic is sound.
    Monster
    The secondary actor used in level 2.
    Position
    Stores position of Tile on board
    Tile
    Tiles make up the maze.
    TreasureTile
    From handout: If Chap steps onto the tile, the treasure (chip) is picked up and added to the treasure chest.
    WallTile
    From handout: Part of a wall, actors cannot move onto those tiles.
  • Enum Summary 
    Enum Description
    Direction
    Enumerates which directions we can travel from current position
    KeyTile.Colour
    Enumerates colours available in assets
